channel.title: [C4D] Alarm clock tutorial
channel.description:
First create a cylinder and make the orientation "+Z", the radius "46m",height"79m" and height segments "10" and rename the cylinder to "clock". Next make a capsule and make the orientation "-x", radius"4m",height"23m" and the position Y coord to "44". Next add a Boolean(objects-modeling-boolean) and place the the clock and capsule under the boolean,the places you put the capsule and the clock under the boolean does matter so place them the way it is in the picture. [img]http://img400.imageshack.us/img400/2659/09302007204134oh0.png[/img] Next add another cylinder and name it "dinghandle" and make its radius "1m",height"33", and position x coord"43". Next make a cyliner and name it "ding" and make the orientation"-z",radius"5m",height"1m",and the position coord"63.698". Next make another cylinder and name it"bellhandle1" and make the radius"1m", height"26m", position x coord"24", position Y"52" and rotaion B choord"27"Next copy bellhandle1 and paste it and rename the second one "bellhandle2" and make its position x coord"-24", and rotation B coord to "-27". Next make a sphere and name it "bell1" and make the radius "15m",make editable and select the Live Selection tool and the pollygon tool and hold down shift and select bottom half of the sphere and delete the selected so its in half, now select the top half of the sphere and right click and choose "Extrude" and make the offset"1m" and apply, now select the object tool and rotation tool and make the rotation "27", position x coord"22.382m", position Y coord" 49.751". Next copy and paste"bell1" and rename the second one "bell2" and make the position x coord "-22.382" and the rotation"-27". [img]http://img210.imageshack.us/img210/808/pic2as0.png[/img] Next create a cylinder and name it"foot1" and make the radius "3m", height "24m", height segments"5", rotation segments "15", position x coord "21m",position Y coord"-51", and rotation B"-30", now make it editable select the bottom most height segment with the live selection tool and pollygon tool [img]http://img395.imageshack.us/img395/7231/pic3gv9.png[/img] and right click and choose "bevel" and set both the extrusion and inner offset to"1m", next copy and paste "foot1" and rename it to "foot2" and make the position x coord "-21m", and the rotation "30m". [img]http://img222.imageshack.us/img222/5254/09302007212919mr5.png[/img] Next click on the "clock" object and make it editable and select the pollygon tool and the live selection tool and select the first two rows of the clock as shown in the picture [img]http://img299.imageshack.us/img299/8885/09302007213333eu2.png[/img] now right click and select "bevel" and make extrusion and inner offset "2m" and apply. Next select the back two rows of the clock with the live selection tool and pollygon tool as shown in the picture [img]http://img401.imageshack.us/img401/9092/09302007213700uk4.png[/img] now right click and choose "bevel" and set the extrusion to "5m" and the inner offset to"3m" and apply. Next add a floor, go to (objects-scene-floor) and set the position Y coord to " -63.412m", make a new material and add a material with these settings[img]http://img340.imageshack.us/img340/9364/pic7vq8.png[/img]
[img]http://img340.imageshack.us/img340/5441/pic8wh5.png[/img]
[img]http://img221.imageshack.us/img221/8615/pic9rk3.png[/img] and rename the material to "floor"and apply to the floor. Now add a "light",(objects-scene-light) and make the type"omni", and shadow"shadow maps(soft)", for the position x coord"207m", and position Y coord"-242". Now add a sky(objects-scene-sky) and make the "use color" to always and for the color make the red,green,and blue "192". Now add a material called" clock" and make the settings match the ones shown in the picture [img]http://img221.imageshack.us/img221/9802/pic10xj9.png[/img]
[img]http://img392.imageshack.us/img392/4175/pic11mj2.png[/img]
[img]http://img120.imageshack.us/img120/9355/pic12pw9.png[/img] and apply to everything besides the capsule,boole,floor,light,and sky. Now add a material and name it "clockface" and save this image [img]http://img229.imageshack.us/img229/9503/imageloaderasprw8.gif[/img] and in the material in the color tab for the texture open up your pictures and select the clock face image you just saved. Now select the live selection tool and polygon tool and select the front of the clock as shown in the image [img]http://img443.imageshack.us/img443/879/09302007224108co2.png[/img] and apply the material with the clock face to it, it will appear upside down so to fix click the material to open and click the clock image and click edit image and rotate the image till its right side up and click "reload image" and it will be fixed. Now to finish we need to add a handle so add an arc spline(objects-spline primitive-arc) and make sure you have the object tool selected and make the be fixed. Now to finish we need to add a handle so add an arc spline(objects-spline primitive-arc) and make sure you have the object tool selected and make the end angle"180",radius"31m", and position y coord "58", now add a circle spline(objects-spline primitive-circle) and make the circles radius "1m", now add a sweepNURBS smf place the splines under it like shown in the picture [img]http://img222.imageshack.us/img222/7973/09302007221002np2.png[/img] and apply the clock material to it. Now the last step, create a new material called" capsule" and make the color black and apply to the capsule. And we are done![img]http://img120.imageshack.us/img120/7150/alarmclock2ti2.png[/img], I wont add the back since its the front and sides thats interesting. Yes I know its long but pretty simple.
You do not have to use my textures, make your own if ya want ;)

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock tutorial
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:13, topic:147574”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=201690.msg1800499#msg1800499 date=1191545924]
You wont find a direct download for C4D anywhere. Buy it, or use the demo version.

STH - Splines and NURBS are, imo, the next step up from primitive shape modeling. I’ve just started work on making and modeling mainly in polys and it’s great fun
[/quote]

I guess true. I barely ever use splines, unless I’m lathenurbsing them.[/quote]

I don’t know who to listen to lol, your both graphic masters so I guess ill start doing splines as mr. criss said, only thing ive used splines for is to make handles,cords which is sweepNURBS, hardly ever use the others beside LatheNURBS.

Read full topic

STH - Splines and NURBS are, imo, the next step up from primitive shape modeling. I’ve just started work on making and modeling mainly in polys and it’s great fun :P[/quote]

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock tutorial
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Then he should learn to model polys themselves, as splines and HyperNURBS aren’t much better.

I am learning to do that along with splines, just so used to primitives but once im good with splines and poly modeling ill post something else, wont update my atom or webcam i don’t think, i know it needs to be more realistic but it wont change the fact that it is primitive.

item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Archer, maybe you should start using splines and NURBS more?

I didn’t see a place that needed them really, for extruding things I just right click and extrude, hyperNURBS wouldn’t work since theres nothing to smooth that really needs it, the others are more for splines and I am not a big fan of splines lol but I could have done with splines.

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock tutorial
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:2, topic:147574”]You didn’t do very good on the materials at all =/

For the floor you should add “Dispersion” to the reflection and make it a high number.

For the clock metal, put color to 20% and reflection to 80%, with both of their colors pure white, and set reflection width a lot lower and height a lot higher.

For the clock part, you should extrude that back with create caps on, seperate that face that the clock part was on and make it glass. Then behind that where the extrude is model all the clock parts instead of a texture.[/quote]

Ill make better materials and add them here in place of the old ones, and I will model the clock parts, I know already it makes it look more real since I did that with my saber and it turned out alot better…just will take a little more time.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock tutorial
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

You didn’t do very good on the materials at all =/

For the floor you should add “Dispersion” to the reflection and make it a high number.

For the clock metal, put color to 20% and reflection to 80%, with both of their colors pure white, and set reflection width a lot lower and height a lot higher.

For the clock part, you should extrude that back with create caps on, seperate that face that the clock part was on and make it glass. Then behind that where the extrude is model all the clock parts instead of a texture.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Alarm clock tutorial
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

First create a cylinder and make the orientation “+Z”, the radius “46m”,height"79m"
and height segments “10” and rename the cylinder to “clock”. Next make a capsule
and make the orientation “-x”, radius"4m",height"23m" and the position Y coord to “44”.
Next add a Boolean(objects-modeling-boolean) and place the the clock and capsule
under the boolean,the places you put the capsule and the clock
under the boolean does matter so place them the way it is in the picture.

Next add another cylinder and name it “dinghandle” and make its radius “1m”,height"33", and position x coord"43". Next make a cyliner and name it “ding” and make the orientation"-z",radius"5m",height"1m",and the position coord"63.698". Next make another cylinder and name it"bellhandle1" and make the radius"1m", height"26m", position x coord"24", position Y"52" and rotaion B choord"27"Next copy bellhandle1 and paste it and rename the second one “bellhandle2” and make its position x coord"-24", and rotation B coord to “-27”. Next make a sphere and name it “bell1” and make the radius “15m”,make editable and select the Live Selection tool and the pollygon tool and hold down shift and select bottom half of the sphere and delete the selected so its in half, now select the top half of the sphere and right click and choose “Extrude” and make the offset"1m" and apply, now select the object tool and rotation tool and make the rotation “27”, position x coord"22.382m", position Y coord" 49.751". Next copy and paste"bell1" and rename the second one “bell2” and make the position x coord “-22.382” and the rotation"-27".

Next create a cylinder and name it"foot1" and make the radius “3m”, height “24m”,
height segments"5", rotation segments “15”, position x coord “21m”,position Y coord"-51", and rotation B"-30", now make it editable select the bottom most height segment with the live selection tool and pollygon tool

and right click and choose “bevel” and set both the extrusion and inner offset to"1m", next copy and paste “foot1” and rename it to “foot2” and make the position x coord “-21m”, and the rotation “30m”.

Next click on the “clock” object and make it editable and select the pollygon tool
and the live selection tool and select the first two rows of the clock as shown in the picture

now right click and select “bevel” and make extrusion and inner offset “2m” and apply. Next select the back two rows of the clock with the live selection tool and
pollygon tool as shown in the picture

now right click and choose “bevel” and set the extrusion to “5m” and the inner offset to"3m" and apply.
Next add a floor, go to (objects-scene-floor) and set the position Y coord to " -63.412m", make a new material
and add a material with these settings


and rename the material to “floor"and apply to the floor.
Now add a “light”,(objects-scene-light) and make the type"omni”, and shadow"shadow maps(soft)", for the position x coord"207m", and position Y coord"-242". Now add a sky(objects-scene-sky) and make the “use color” to always and for the color make the red,green,and blue “192”. Now add a material called" clock" and make the settings match the ones shown in the picture


and
apply to everything besides the capsule,boole,floor,light,and sky.
Now add a material and name it “clockface” and save this image

and in the material in the color tab for the texture open up your pictures and select the clock face image you just saved. Now select the live selection tool and polygon tool and select the front of the clock as shown in the image

and apply the material with the clock face to it, it will appear upside down so to fix click the material to open and click the clock image and click edit image and rotate the image till its right side up and click “reload image” and it will be fixed. Now to finish we need to add a handle so add an arc spline(objects-spline primitive-arc) and make sure you have the object tool selected and make the be fixed. Now to finish we need to add a handle so add an arc spline(objects-spline primitive-arc) and make sure you have the object tool selected and make the end angle"180",radius"31m", and position y coord “58”, now add a circle spline(objects-spline primitive-circle) and make the circles radius “1m”, now add a sweepNURBS smf place the splines under it like shown in the picture

and apply the clock material to it. Now the last step, create a new material called" capsule" and make the color black and apply to the capsule. And we are done!,
I wont add the back since its the front and sides thats interesting. Yes I know its long but pretty simple.

You do not have to use my textures, make your own if ya want

Read full topic
